alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:01PM EST until January 12 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Twiggs, Monroe, Jones and Bibb Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oconee, Oglethorpe and Greene Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Baldwin, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Johnson, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River at Milledgeville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor flooding continues upstream and downstream from the gage located around one half mile upstream from the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. The parking lot and portions of the Oconee River Greenway Park just downstream from the bridge will be flooded. Low lying areas of woodlands and pasture near the river will be flooded one to two feet deep. Sinclair Dam will likely have two gates open to reach this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 24.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EST Thursday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 14.1 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 04/16/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EST.
